name: DreamHost Web Panel Dark (Updated 09/19/2015)
description: DreamHost got a new updated webpanel. It looks good, but it needs to be darker. That's my goal!
additional_info:
Well, I guess it's stable enough for a release...

Version: 0.1
Released: 09/19/2015 at 12:35 UTC

So, I've done a lot more work on the nitty gritty of DreamHost's panel. This first release looks pretty good, and I've done my best to make it work for every little box and dialog. DreamHost's webpanel is actually kind of a mess of code from way back when they first started, mixed with things that have been added since, all the way to now. So far, most things I have tested look okay. I do hope to get a list of exactly what is known to work and what is known to be failsauce. It should also be noted that I don't have a DreamHost VPS or dedicated account, so I can't really test it in those areas. Just because it's not listed doesn't mean it doesn't work. Please report any bugs to me so I can update the list and I know what I need to work on.

You can reach me via email coltondrg[at]coltondrg[dot]com

Definitely working
- Shared hosting
- Domains
- Domain registrations
- Email
- MySQL
- Users & Groups
- Billing & Account (all screens)
- Support Submission & History
- Subversion
- Secure Hosting

Definitely NOT working
- One-Click Installs (You shouldn't use these anyway. Installing webapps is not hard.)
- DreamObjects

Probably not working (I can't test)
- Stop the Hacker (I don't use it)
- VPS (I don't have one)
- Dedicated Server (I don't have one)
- DreamCompute (Don't have that either)
- DreamPress (Why on earth would I pay that freaking much for WordPress?)
- Mobile Site Builder (I'll build it myself, thanks.)

If the feature you're looking for isn't listed here, there's a decent chance it works fine, but don't count on it.

Patch Notes
